protocol_header.name: User Datagram Protocol (UDP)
protocol_header.description: The User Datagram Protocol (UDP) provides a simple, connectionless, and transaction-oriented communication mechanism with minimal protocol overhead. It is used for applications that do not require reliable delivery of data streams.

fields.name: Source Port
fields.description: An optional field indicating the port of the sending process. If meaningful, it specifies the port to which replies should be addressed in the absence of other information.
constraints: If unused, the value is set to zero.
The field is optional but recommended for reply purposes.

fields.name: Destination Port
fields.description: Specifies the destination port within the context of the destination internet address.
constraints: This field must always be present and meaningful.
Its interpretation depends on the destination IP address.

fields.name: Length
fields.description: Indicates the total length of the UDP datagram, including the header and data, measured in octets.
constraints: The minimum value of this field is 8, as the header itself is 8 octets long.
The length includes both the header and the payload.

fields.name: Checksum
fields.description: A 16-bit one's complement checksum computed over a pseudo-header derived from the IP header, the UDP header, and the data. The checksum provides error detection.
constraints: If the computed checksum is zero, it is transmitted as all ones (0xFFFF).
A transmitted checksum value of zero indicates that no checksum was generated by the sender.
The checksum calculation includes padding the data to ensure it is a multiple of two octets.
